newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent soars over $18 on gasoline boost.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent soars over $18 on gasoline boost.

text.p: IPE Brent crude futures broke effortlessly above $18 a barrel on Tuesday, helped higher by a rally in U.S. gasoline markets, brokers said.
IPE August front month Brent was trading at $18.35, 53 cents higher, at 1841 GMT. September was 54 cents higher at $18.40.
Brent gained sharp impetus from August WTI's break above $19.50 a barrel which triggered a series of stops.
"Gasoline is behind this and the market was in need of a correction after yesterday's falls," an IPE trader said.
"Normally you don't see quite such a dramatic move on both markets ahead of the APIs."

August WTI was trading 60 cents higher at $19.59, likewise boosted by gasoline, which jumped on talk that Tuesday's report from the American Petroleum Institute (API) will show possibly the last sizeable drawdown of unleaded stocks of the summer.
August NYMEX unleaded was 1.55 cent a gallon higher at 59.90 cents.
